content: >http://www.nationalpost.com/news/world/story.html?id=1612265 Cases of flu in the US continue to rise and new outbreaks are reported in Japan. Increases on Mexico have slowed but not stopped. World-wide 10 000 cases have been reported with 80 deaths attributed. Authorities expect a reduction over the summer with a more serious outbreak again in the fall.
reply: >http://www.nationalpost.com/news/world/story.html?id=1612265 Cases of flu in the US continue to rise and new outbreaks are reported in Japan. Increases on Mexico have slowed but not stopped. World-wide 10 000 cases have been reported with 80 deaths attributed. Authorities expect a reduction over the summer with a more serious outbreak again in the fall.
title: Swine Flu Gains Momentum
